1.speaker: PANDA
1.english: Hello! What's with the getup? I'm starting a new job that I'll be doing once a week.

2.speaker: PENGUIN
2.japanese: えぇ　やめるんじゃなくて 増やすの
2.english: What?! You're not quitting but adding another job?

4.speaker: SASAKO
4.japanese: かわいいね　パンダ柄
4.english: That's a very cute panda design.

5.speaker: PANDA
5.english: You get it, too, Miss Sasako?

6.speaker: PENGUIN
6.japanese: で　どんなバイトなの
6.english: So, what kind of job is it?

9.speaker: PENGUIN
9.japanese: 皆目見当つかないんだけど
9.english: I have no idea what you're talking about.

10.speaker: PANDA
10.japanese: 知らないの　ローラーだよ　ローラー
10.english: You don't know what that is? A roller. Rol-ler.

11.speaker: PENGUIN
11.japanese: カーラー　それやったよね
11.english: Curlers. We did that before, didn't we?

12.speaker: PENGUIN
12.japanese: セーラー　それもやったよね

13.speaker: PENGUIN
13.japanese: ディーラー　それも…

16.speaker: PANDA
16.japanese: ローラーじゃなくて　ディーラーだった
16.english: Not a roller, I meant a dealer.

17.speaker: SASAKO
17.english: You're going to work at a casino?

18.speaker: PANDA
18.japanese: ううん　かっこいい車を売るの
18.english: Nope. I'm going to sell cool-looking cars.

19.speaker: SASAKO
19.japanese: それって…　車のディーラー
19.english: You mean at a car dealership?

20.speaker: PENGUIN
20.japanese: キミが　車を売るの
20.english: You? You're going to sell cars?

21.speaker: PANDA
21.japanese: 大丈夫　ネクタイしてるし
21.english: I'll be fine. I'm wearing a tie. Why on earth would they hire you?

22.speaker: PANDA
22.japanese: あ～あ　楽しみだなぁ

23.speaker: PANDA
23.english: I wonder what I'll have to do.

24.speaker: PENGUIN
24.japanese: 売るんじゃない　車を
24.english: I think that you might be selling, you know... cars.

25.speaker: PANDA
25.japanese: あれ　お客さんですか
25.english: Oh? Are you a customer? I am...

28.speaker: PANDA
28.japanese: 新しく入った　パンダです

29.speaker: GUY
29.japanese: はぁ　そう じゃあちょっといいかね
29.english: Oh, I see. Then could you help me out a little?

30.speaker: PANDA
30.japanese: ちょっとだけならいいですよ

32.speaker: GUY
32.japanese: あぁ　この車 オプションはなにがあるのかね
32.english: So, what options do you have for this car?

34.speaker: GUY
34.japanese: え～っと… エアバックはついてるのかな

35.speaker: PANDA
35.japanese: バックしますよ　させますか
35.english: It'll go back. Would you like it to go back?

36.speaker: GUY
36.japanese: えっ…　じゃあ燃費は

37.speaker: PANDA
37.japanese: もっと違う質問ないですか
37.english: Don't you have any other questions?

39.speaker: PANDA
39.japanese: パンダのこととか　竹のこととか

40.speaker: GUY
40.japanese: だれか…　他の人いないかな
40.english: Is there someone else I can talk to?

41.speaker: PANDA
41.japanese: どっちが聞きたいですか
41.english: Which would you like to ask about?

43.speaker: PANDA
43.japanese: どっちが聞きたいですか
43.english: Which would you like to ask about? Pandas, I guess?

44.speaker: PANDA
44.japanese: パンダは…　こんな感じでぇ～す
44.english: Pandas look like this! You're cute and all, but I'm a bit lost here...

45.speaker: PENGUIN
45.japanese: 辛抱強いお客さんだね

46.speaker: PANDA
46.japanese: 自然体って大事だよねぇ
46.english: Being natural is very important, isn't it?

47.speaker: PENGUIN
47.japanese: それが通用するのは動物園だけじゃない
47.english: I think that only works at the zoo.

48.speaker: PANDA
48.english: But I was able to sell a car, too.

49.speaker: PENGUIN
49.english: What?! How? I told you, I was being natural.

50.speaker: SUIT
50.japanese: これでも起きないって すごいなぁ…
50.english: I can't believe he still hasn't woken up.

51.speaker: CUST
51.japanese: なんでパンダが乗っかってるの
51.english: Why's there a panda on the car?

54.speaker: SUIT
54.japanese: パンダを乗せてもヘコまない 強靭なボディー
54.english: even a panda can lay on it without denting it!

55.speaker: SUIT
55.japanese: 眠りを妨げないエンジン音は
55.english: And our state-of-the-art engine is so much quieter

56.speaker: SUIT
56.japanese: 他社と比べて 頭１つ　抜きんでております
56.english: than our competitors, it's not even disturbing his sleep.

59.speaker: CUST
59.japanese: ちょっと乗ってみていい
59.english: Could I take it for a test drive?

60.speaker: SUIT
60.japanese: ありがとうございます

61.speaker: PENGUIN
61.japanese: 店員さんの手柄じゃない
61.english: That would be the salesman's sale.

62.speaker: PANDA
62.japanese: でも　僕のおかげだって 褒められたよ
62.english: But he said it was because of me. He said sales have gone up,

63.speaker: PANDA
63.japanese: また　車の上で寝てくれって
63.english: and asked me to sleep on top of cars again.

64.speaker: PENGUIN
64.japanese: 販売員というよりは マスコットキャラだね
64.english: So you're more of a mascot than a salesman.

65.speaker: PENGUIN
65.japanese: まあ　上手くいってるみたいでよかったね
65.english: Anyway, I'm glad things are going well for you.

66.speaker: PANDA
66.japanese: それで　転職したんだ

67.speaker: PENGUIN
67.english: Why?! One of our regulars is the head of his own company,

68.speaker: PANDA
68.japanese: そこの会社で 働くことになったんだ～
68.english: and I got asked to work there.

69.speaker: PENGUIN
69.japanese: 今度はどんな仕事なの
69.english: What kind of job is it?

70.speaker: PANDA
70.japanese: ウリウリカイカイみたいな仕事だよ
70.english: It's like "sell, sell, buy, buy" {\i1}(uri, uri, kai, kai){\i0}. Melon, melon {\i1}(uri, uri){\i0}? Polar Bear's Café

73.speaker: GUY
73.japanese: マルビの株ですが 部長の読みどおりでした
73.english: You were exactly correct in regards to Marubi's stocks, sir.

74.speaker: BOSS
74.japanese: そうか ヨツビシのほうはどうなって…
74.english: I see. What's going on with Yotsubishi?

75.speaker: GUY
75.japanese: いつから　パンダが部長に…
75.english: Since when is a panda the department chief?

77.speaker: PANDA
77.japanese: あの…　ここは 何をする会社なんですか
77.english: Um, what does this company do?

78.speaker: GUY
78.japanese: どうやら　部長ってわけでも ないみたいですね…
78.english: It looks like he's not actually the department chief.

82.speaker: BOSS
82.japanese: こりゃ　また 人事部も思い切ったことを…
82.english: Looks like HR is getting creative...

83.speaker: PANDA
83.japanese: ウリウリカイカイって　何
83.english: What does sell, sell, buy, buy mean?

84.speaker: BOSS
84.english: Why don't you look after him for a while?

86.speaker: GUY
86.japanese: いい　もう１回説明するから よく聞いて
86.english: All right. I'll explain it one more time, so listen carefully.

87.speaker: GUY
87.japanese: これをサポートラインといって
87.english: This is called a support line,

88.speaker: GUY
88.japanese: これよりも下がったら　売り
88.english: and if it goes under this line, you sell.

89.speaker: GUY
89.japanese: この線に近づいたときが　買い
89.english: If it gets closer to the line, you buy.

90.speaker: GUY
90.japanese: 反対に　この山の部分を つないだ線を…
90.english: And when this thin line connects here...

92.speaker: GUY
92.japanese: かわいいは かわいいんだよな

93.speaker: PANDA
93.english: Sell... sell... buy... bamboo grass... Could I get a large serving of bamboo grass?

94.speaker: PENGUIN
94.japanese: で　会社のお金で １０万株も買っちゃったの
94.english: And you bought 100,000 shares with the company's money?!

96.speaker: PENGUIN
96.japanese: どうして　キミを雇ったんだろう
96.english: Why on earth would they hire you?

97.speaker: PANDA
97.japanese: でもね　すごく儲かったんだって
97.english: But apparently, they made a lot of money.

99.speaker: SASAKO
99.japanese: 運がいいんだね　パンダくん
99.english: You have very good luck, Panda.

100.speaker: PENGUIN
100.japanese: けどね　キミ　運だけじゃ この先　やっていけないよ
100.english: But you know, you're not going to be able to keep the job with just luck.

101.speaker: PENGUIN
101.japanese: ボロが出ないうちに 辞めたほうがいいんじゃないかな
101.english: Maybe you should quit while you're ahead.

106.speaker: PANDA
106.japanese: 今度は 営業セミナーの講師になるんだ
106.english: Now I'm going to be a lecturer at a sales seminar.

107.speaker: PENGUIN
107.japanese: えっ　キミが 何を教えられるっていうの
107.english: What?! What are you going to be able to teach exactly?

109.speaker: POLAR BEAR
109.japanese: あのドアの脇の… 観葉植物は何かな
109.english: what's that decorative plant in the doorway?

110.speaker: PENGUIN
110.japanese: そっち　観葉植物より 隣の人でしょ　あれ　誰
110.english: You're going with that? How about the guy standing next to the plant? Who is that?

114.speaker: PENGUIN
114.japanese: あぁ　どうも　ペンギンと申します
114.english: Oh, thank you. My name is Penguin.

115.speaker: PANDA
115.japanese: シロクマくん　彼にも笹あげて 大盛りでね
115.english: Could you get him some bamboo grass, too, Polar Bear? A large serving, please.

116.speaker: PENGUIN
116.japanese: コーヒーのほうが いいんじゃないかな

117.speaker: PANDA
117.japanese: こんにちは　パンダです

118.speaker: PANDA
118.japanese: 今日皆さんにお話するのは人生のあり方についてです
118.english: What I want to talk about today is how to live life. I work twice a week at the zoo.

119.speaker: PANDA
119.japanese: これが　その写真です
119.english: This is a picture of that.

120.speaker: PANDA
120.japanese: 一緒に　ダラダラしているのは
120.english: The person lazing around with me is my mentor, Mr. Full-time Panda.

121.speaker: PANDA
121.japanese: お手元の資料の２ページ目をご覧ください
121.english: Please take a look at page two of your handout. There is a very important picture there.

122.speaker: PANDA
122.japanese: お母さんに掃除機で吸われている僕です
122.english: That is me getting sucked upby my mom's vacuum.

123.speaker: GUY
123.japanese: どういう趣旨の講演だ
123.english: What's the point of this lecture?

125.speaker: GUY2
125.japanese: だが　かわいいのは確かだな

127.speaker: GUY
127.japanese: いやぁ　かわいかったね

128.speaker: GUY2
128.japanese: こういうのも たまには　いいですね
128.english: This was a nice change of pace. Let's do our best starting tomorrow. I see.

129.speaker: PENGUIN
129.japanese: そう　社内の空気がよくなって 業績が上がったの
129.english: So the workplace morale went up and performance improved.

131.speaker: PANDA
131.japanese: って　そんな甘いもんなの 世の中って
131.english: Yup. Really?! Is the world really that simple?!

132.speaker: PANDA
132.japanese: それから　本も出したんだ

136.speaker: SASAKO
136.japanese: へぇ～　写真集を出したんだ
136.english: Wow. So you released a photobook?

138.speaker: PENGUIN
138.japanese: どう見ても ただの写真集だよね
138.english: No matter how you look at it,this is just a photobook.

139.speaker: PANDA
139.japanese: で　いろいろあって　今は…
139.english: Then a lot of other things happened and now...

141.speaker: MARU
141.japanese: はい　ＣＥＯでございます

142.speaker: PANDA
142.english: I wonder what CEO means. Calculating Egotistical Your turn, Miss Sasako.

144.speaker: PENGUIN
144.japanese: まぁ　そういう解釈もあるかもしれないけどさ
144.english: Well, I guess that's one way of explaining it,

145.speaker: PENGUIN
145.japanese: ＣＥＯって 最高経営責任者でしょ
145.english: but CEO stands for Chief Executive Officer, doesn't it?

146.speaker: PENGUIN
146.japanese: 会社で いちばん偉い人じゃない
146.english: They're the most important person in a company.

147.speaker: PANDA
147.japanese: 僕　かわいいだけじゃなくて 偉いんだ
147.english: So I'm not just cute, I'm important.

148.speaker: SASAKO
148.japanese: すごいね　パンダくん

149.speaker: PENGUIN
149.japanese: すごいの　ひと言ですませていいのかな
149.english: Should we be ending this conversation with "impressive"?

150.speaker: MARU
150.japanese: ご歓談中　すみません

151.speaker: MARU
151.japanese: パンダくん様 そろそろ　お時間でございます
151.english: but we should be leaving soon, Mr. Panda.

153.speaker: POLAR BEAR
153.japanese: 人生って　計り知れない可能性に満ちてるね
153.english: Life is filled with an endless amount of opportunities.

154.speaker: PENGUIN
154.japanese: いや　おかしいでしょ

158.speaker: POLAR BEAR
158.japanese: いらっしゃい　あれ ネクタイは

159.speaker: SASAKO
159.english: Are you off from work today?

160.speaker: PANDA
160.japanese: もう来なくていいって言われたの
160.english: I was told I didn't need to come anymore. I see. I'm sorry to hear that.

161.speaker: POLAR BEAR
161.japanese: ていうか いままでよくもったよね
161.english: Or rather, I'm surprised you lasted that long.

162.speaker: PANDA
162.japanese: あれ　今日は ペンギンさんは来てないの
162.english: Oh? Mr. Penguin's not here today?

163.speaker: GUY
163.japanese: ちょっと　何　寝てんの

165.speaker: PENGUIN
165.japanese: ここで寝てたら　ＣＥＯに…
165.english: I thought I could become a CEO if I laid here...

168.speaker: POLAR BEAR
168.japanese: 僕はね　実は　地肌は黒いんだよ
168.english: You know, my scalp is actually black.

169.speaker: POLAR BEAR
169.japanese: 全身　白い毛で覆われてるから わかんないだろうけど
169.english: Though you probably couldn't tell because I'm covered in white fur.

171.speaker: POLAR BEAR
171.japanese: どこか剃ってみようか

173.speaker: PENGUIN
173.japanese: 空　飛びたいんだけど
173.english: I want to be able to fly.

174.speaker: POLAR BEAR
174.japanese: ふ～ん　おかわりどうする
174.english: Hm? Do you want another drink?

176.speaker: PANDA
176.japanese: 別に飛ばなくてもいいよ
176.english: You don't really need to fly. That was a fast rejection.

177.speaker: SASAKO
177.japanese: 確かに 空飛べたらいいですよね
177.english: It would be nice to be able to fly.

178.speaker: PENGUIN
178.english: So you get what I'm saying, Miss Sasako?

179.speaker: SASAKO
179.japanese: 家からカフェまで楽に来られるし
179.english: I'd be able to easily get from my house to the café.

180.speaker: PENGUIN
180.japanese: そういうことじゃないんだよ…

181.speaker: SASAKO
181.japanese: どういうことなんですか

182.speaker: PENGUIN
182.japanese: なんていうか海で泳ぐとすごく楽しいけど
182.english: How do I say this... Like when you swim in the ocean, it's really fun.

183.speaker: PENGUIN
183.japanese: きっと　空を飛ぶのもすてきだと思うんだよね
183.english: But I think it'd be amazing to fly, too.

184.speaker: PANDA
184.japanese: 全然　飛べないんだね
184.english: You can't fly at all, huh?

185.speaker: PENGUIN
185.japanese: だから言ったじゃない。
185.english: I already told you that. But you have wings.

186.speaker: PENGUIN
186.japanese: これは　羽じゃないから

190.speaker: PENGUIN
190.english: That would be a rapper {\i1}(rappa){\i0}! Hey ma— Flippers are like fins, right? So they're not wings?

191.speaker: PANDA
191.japanese: じゃあ　どうやって 飛べばいいの
191.english: How are you supposed to fly, then?

193.speaker: PENGUIN
193.japanese: それで飛べたら みんな飛べちゃうんじゃないかな
193.english: If that's all it took, I think everyone could fly.

194.speaker: PANDA
194.japanese: 僕　いいこと思いついたよ

197.speaker: PENGUIN
197.japanese: これで 飛べるわけないじゃない
197.english: There's no way I could fly like this.

198.speaker: POLAR BEAR
198.japanese: ペンギンさん　こっち　こっち
198.english: Mr. Penguin. Over here, over here.

199.speaker: PENGUIN
199.japanese: 焚き火するために　こんなもの つけたんじゃないんだけど
199.english: I didn't put these on to start a fire for you guys.

202.speaker: PANDA
202.japanese: 羽くっつけただけじゃ 意味ないね
202.english: I guess there's no point in just sticking feathers on you.

203.speaker: PENGUIN
203.japanese: つける前に気づいてよ
203.english: Realize that before you do it!

204.speaker: PENGUIN
204.japanese: 今度は風船くっつけるの
204.english: Now you're going to stick a balloon on me? Wow!

205.speaker: PENGUIN
205.japanese: 目的　見失ってるから

206.speaker: PENGUIN
206.japanese: 扇風機　背中にくっつけて いったい　何がしたいの
206.english: What are you trying to accomplish by sticking a fan on my back?

208.speaker: PENGUIN
208.japanese: そもそも無理のあるプランだけど 電源は
208.english: I think this plan is going to fail, but how are we going to turn it on?

210.speaker: PENGUIN
210.japanese: 空まで届かないでしょ

211.speaker: POLAR BEAR
211.japanese: いや　これで空まで飛べないから
211.english: No, you wouldn't be able to fly with this.

212.speaker: POLAR BEAR
212.english: What about fireworks? I don't see that ending well for me.

214.speaker: PANDA
214.japanese: 僕たち鳥じゃないから わからないよね
214.english: We're not birds, so it's not like we'd know.

215.speaker: PANDA
215.japanese: どうやったら　空飛べるの
215.english: What do you have to do to fly?

218.speaker: POLAR BEAR
218.japanese: カンムリワシさん　どうも
218.english: What do you think, Mr. Crested Serpent Eagle?

219.speaker: EAGLE
219.japanese: 急に呼び出しといて何
219.english: Why did you call me out here all of a sudden?

220.speaker: POLAR BEAR
220.japanese: どうしても飛びたいって ペンギンさんがね
220.english: Mr. Penguin says he wants to fly, no matter what.

221.speaker: EAGLE
221.japanese: ああ　そう じゃあ いくよ
221.english: Oh. Well, here we go. Ow, ow, ow, ow! Ow! Ow, ow, ow!

230.speaker: PENGUIN
230.japanese: 全然　飛んだ気がしないんだけど
230.english: I don't feel like I flew at all.

231.speaker: PENGUIN
231.japanese: 痛かったことしか記憶にないし

232.speaker: PANDA
232.japanese: ペンギンさんの夢が叶ったのに
232.english: But your dream came true, Mr. Penguin.

234.speaker: PENGUIN
234.japanese: でも　全然 達成感ないんだよね
234.english: But I don't feel like I accomplished anything.

235.speaker: POLAR BEAR
235.japanese: ほら　焼き芋できたよ

237.speaker: POLAR BEAR
237.japanese: 焚き火で焼くと　ひと味　違うよね
237.english: It's always better when you make it in a bonfire.

240.speaker: PENGUIN
240.japanese: 僕が　空飛ぶ話は どうなったのかな
240.english: but what happened to me trying to fly?

241.speaker: SASAKO
241.japanese: ペンギンさん　私　考えたんです
241.english: Mr. Penguin, I thought of something.

242.speaker: SASAKO
242.japanese: 目を閉じてみてください
242.english: Close your eyes. Enjoy flying in the world of imagination.

245.speaker: PANDA
245.japanese: あ～　グリズリーさん

246.speaker: PANDA
246.japanese: ペンギンさんが空飛ぶ いい方法　ない
246.english: Do you know of a good way of making Mr. Penguin fly?

247.speaker: GRIZZLY
247.japanese: ほぉ　そんなの簡単じゃねえか

249.speaker: PENGUIN
249.japanese: そういうことじゃないんだよ

251.speaker: PENGUIN
251.japanese: あぁ やっぱり　気持よさそうだな～

252.speaker: PANDA
252.japanese: 僕ね　いいこと思いついたよ
252.english: Hey, I've got a great idea.

254.speaker: PENGUIN
254.japanese: 鳥って こんな景色を見てるんだ…
254.english: So this is what a bird sees.

255.speaker: PENGUIN
255.japanese: なんだか 海の中にもよく似てる
255.english: It's sort of similar to being in the ocean.

256.speaker: POLAR BEAR
256.english: Thanks for all of your hard work!

257.speaker: SASAKO
257.english: Thank you for all of your hard work.

259.speaker: PANDA
259.english: I'm tired. I'm happy for Mr. Penguin.

260.speaker: POLAR BEAR
260.japanese: 一時は どうなることかと思ったけどね
260.english: I didn't know how it was going to turn out at one point.

262.speaker: PENGUIN
262.japanese: お～い　お～い　お～い

263.speaker: PENGUIN
263.japanese: そろそろ　おりたいんだけどな～
263.english: I'd like to come down now.

266.speaker: SLOTH
266.japanese: こ～　こ～　で～　す～

267.speaker: SLOTH
267.japanese: い～ま　助けに～　いくよ～

268.speaker: PENGUIN
268.japanese: 僕…　いつになったら おりられるのかな
268.english: I wonder when I'll be able to get down.

269.speaker: PANDA
269.japanese: ペンギンさん　ペンギンさん

271.speaker: PANDA
271.japanese: どうしてお金持ちのおじさんは
271.english: I'm curious as to why rich old men

272.speaker: PANDA
272.japanese: 僕を遺産のそうぞくにんにしないんだろう
272.english: won't make me an heir to their fortune.

273.speaker: PENGUIN
273.japanese: 君と全く関係ないからだよ
273.english: That'd be because they have no relation to you.

274.speaker: PANDA
274.japanese: じゃペンギンさん　僕に毎月仕送りしてよ
274.english: Then, Mr. Penguin, you should send me money each month.

276.speaker: PANDA
276.japanese: ペンギンさんって自分勝手だね

277.speaker: PENGUIN
277.japanese: 自分勝手の概念が今ここで変わったね
277.english: Apparently the definition for "selfish" has been changed.

279.speaker: POLAR BEAR
279.japanese: 来週のしろくまカフェは

280.speaker: POLAR BEAR
280.japanese: モザイクでお送りします
280.english: will be presented to you in mosaic.
